intro: Callicoma ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty callicoma, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Callicoma ferruginea is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
